column1: As Tucker U expounded in  Russell v.  Duke of Norfolk  [(1949)  1 All  E.R.  109 at 117J :

column2: "There are, in my view, no words which are of universal application to every kind of inquiry
and  kind  of domestic  tribunal.  The  requirements  of natural justice  must depend on  the
circumstances of the cose,  the nature of the inquiry,  the rules under which the tribunal is
acting,  the  subject-matter  that  is  being  dealt  with,  and so forth.  Accordingly,  I do  not
derive much assistance from  the definitions of natural justice which have been fram  time
time  used,  but,  whatever  standard  is  adopted,  one  essential  is
concerned should have a reasonable opportunity to present his case."
